articles.content:
New federation of unions formed in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The "National Federation of Office and Banking Clerks Unions" was inaugurated on Friday as a new organization involving 65,000 members under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), a Seoul-based radio reported.   The federation is the merger of the Office Clerks Union and the Banking Clerks Union.   2 unions decided to join hands with each other at a meeting of deputies on February 11 and worked for the formation of new organization after asking the "Ministry of Labor" for license.   As a result, the number of subsidiary unions of KCTU totaled 15.

articles.content:
Congratulatory message to Nigerian President
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) --Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on March 3 sent a congratulatory message to Olusegun Obasanjo  on his election as President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.   It expressed the conviction that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Nigeria will continue to grow strong on good terms in the future.   It wished big success in his responsible work for the country's political stability and economic development.

articles.content:
Message of condolences to emir of Bahrain 
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sunday sent a message of condolences to emir Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa on the death of Isa Bin Sulman al-Khalifa, emir of the State of Bahrain.   The message expressed deep condolences to the emir and he family of the deceased.
